One take on the MMM (multiclass melee mage) combo Wizard/Ranger/Assassin. Played melee mage style of course, halfling and sling are chosen for the extra AB/AC. PBS means another +1 AB within 15 feet of the target (same limit for DA range) and RS means an extra attack. The melee option is present and one can take advantage of Ranger's dual wield too. Trap setting/recovering is important to this character and by the third assassin level he is fully proficient with deadly traps. The high INT makes the DA a useful and effective resource to paralyze mobs and possibly bosses on a (un)lucky roll. Going elf would avoid the XP penalty, but loses halfling smallsize boni.

Hey man!

Kail isn't here anymore, but I'll try to answer within the boundaries of my knowledge:

1- Combat Casting is HORRIBLE. Nothing justifies ever taking it. There is Defensive Casting Mode available, but I have never used it. Just know when to cast and when to run and you'll never need it.
2- Kail used to play on WoG. There, the XP penalty is something you can live with.
3- Assassin at those levels is taken because UMD is modified by CHA, which is negative, and it increases in usefulness in multiples of 5 (but doesn't count base ranks, like Tumble does, it uses the modified skill total, therefore it allows him to have another upgrade to UMD by delaying the skill dumps one level)

Take it EZ!
